title: Brendan and Alex Fevola reveal they are becoming foster parents
text:
Brendan Fevola and his fiancée Alex will become foster parents when their children leave the nest, the retired footy star revealed on Wednesday.

Speaking on Fox FM, Brendan said he and Alex came to the decision after watching the film Instant Family, starring Mark Wahlberg and Rose Byrne.

The couple sat down to watch the adoption-themed comedy movie for 'a bit of fun' but were soon swept up by the idea of fostering children.

Giving back: Brendan Fevola and his fiancée Alex (pictured) will become foster parents when their children leave the nest, the retired footy star revealed on Wednesday

'I reckon the foster ratio would have gone through the roof after watching this movie,' he said.

'We cried, we laughed, it was one of the greatest movies I've ever seen! Alex and I sat there [and said], "I want to foster, I want to adopt a kid".'

Brendan's co-host, Fifi Box, pointed out that the former Carlton player already has four children, including a baby.

Inspiration: Speaking on Fox FM, Brendan said he and Alex came to the decision after watching the film Instant Family (pictured), starring Mark Wahlberg and Rose Byrne

'I know, I know but these kids [foster children] just go through absolute traumatic circumstances,' Brendan replied.

'We could change someone's life. We could get a kid that's in foster care that goes from house to house and just adopt and give them a beautiful life.'

Fifi agreed, saying that Brendan and Alex had already proved their abilities as foster parents when they mentored young footy star Daniel Rioli after he was briefly dropped from Richmond.

Meet the family: Brendan and Alex share four daughters: Mia, Lulu, Leni and Tobi. The family is pictured on November 5, 2016 in Melbourne

Brendan and Alex married in 2005, divorced in 2014, but announced they were engaged for a second time in 2016.

Alex has a teenage daughter, Mia, from a previous relationship, and three younger daughters with Brendan: Lulu, Leni and Tobi.

Fifi, Fev & Byron airs weekdays from 6am to 9am on Melbourne's 101.9 The Fox
